metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2305 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the regcomp implementation in the Henry Spencer BSD regex library (aka rxspencer) alpha3.8.g5 on 32-bit platforms, as used in NetBSD through 6.1.5 and other products, might allow context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrary code via a large regular expression that leads to a heap-based buffer overflow. It was discovered that regcomp implementation has a buffer overflow that affects vigor. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service (crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2305` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
